data_structures: list of lists (adjacency list for graph)
algorithm_technique: Greedy coloring using adjacency list and set operations.
Graph coloring with backtracking or constraint satisfaction.
problem_summary_simple: Assign one of four flower types to each garden so adjacent gardens have different types.
problem_summary_technical: Build an adjacency list, then greedily assign the first available flower type to each garden.
key_insights: The problem is a graph coloring problem where each node (garden) must have a different color than its neighbors.
Since each garden has at most 3 neighbors, and there are 4 flower types, a valid assignment is always possible (greedy approach works).
Using an adjacency list to represent the graph is efficient for storing connections.
